Stitched and bound by love and fear books monsters and Mary ... Frankenstein is an essay by Rebecca Bowman head of public services up the ... library at Indiana University
Written to mark the two hundredth anniversary of the publication of Frankenstein dominant opens with a quote from Cheryl Honda director of Godzilla who believes monsters are tragic beans and they are born to toe too strong too heavy
Director of Godzilla who believes monsters are tragic beans and they are born to toll too strong too heavy
They're not evil by choice not his their tragedy they do not attack people because they want to but because of their size and strength humankind has no other choice but to defend to defend itself
And after several stories such as this people end up having a kind of affection for the monsters they end up caring about them and ... contends all books are monsters
They are created things sewn together by their authors from ideas memories and most important from fragments and half digested scraps of other books
Than they are printed stitched inbound sent out into the world to inspire love or cause fear
They do not always obey their creators it can be dangerous Mary Shelley concluded the introduction to the Eighteenth thirty one edition of Frankenstein by writing and now once again I begged my hideous progeny go forth and prosper
I have an affection for it for it was the offspring of happy days when death and grief were but words which found no true echo in my heart in the interim between the first and third additions she had known unspeakable lost
